wing.translation[0].definitions[0].defin: one of the parts of a bird’s or insect’s body that it uses for flying
wing.translation[0].definitions[0].examp: a butterfly with beautiful markings on its wings
The pheasant flapped its wings vigorously.
wing.translation[0].definitions[1].defin: the meat on the wing bone of a chicken, duck etc, eaten as food
wing.translation[0].definitions[2].defin: one of the large flat parts that stick out from the side of a plane and help to keep it in the air
wing.translation[0].definitions[3].defin: one of the parts of a large building, especially one that sticks out from the main part
wing.translation[0].definitions[3].examp: She works in the hospital’s maternity wing.
the east wing of the palace
wing.translation[0].definitions[4].defin: a group of people within a political party or other organization who have a particular opinion or aim
wing.translation[0].definitions[4].examp: the moderate wing of the Republican Party
wing.translation[0].definitions[6].defin: the far left or right part of a sports field
wing.translation[0].definitions[7].defin: the part of a car that is above a wheel
wing.translation[0].note_box[0].sections: The ducks woke up and flapped their wings.
The female beats her wings as fast as 500 times a second.
I heard some birds fluttering their wings outside the window.
The dragon spread its wings and gave an experimental flap.
The cage was so small the birds could not even stretch their wings.
Gannets fold their wings and plummet like an arrow into the sea to catch their prey.
The eagle descended on outstretched wings.
wing.translation[1].definitions[0].examp: a flock of geese winging down the coast
planes winging their way to exotic destinations
wing its/their way to/across etc something
